headline: From Nvidia to Salesforce: Where money is made in Enterprise AI
summary: Listen and subscribe to Stocks In Translation on Apple Podcasts, Spotify, or wherever you find your favorite podcast. Forget chatbots, here's where AI is really going to make strides in 2026. In this episode of Stocks in Translation, The Futurum Group Daniel Newman joins host Jared Blikre and Yahoo Finance Senior Reporter Brooke DiPalma to break down where enterprise AI is really making money. Newman highlights top beneficiaries like Nvidia (NVDA), Salesforce (CRM), ServiceNow (NOW), Workday (WDAY), and IBM (IBM), and explains how AI is reshaping healthcare, defense, and SaaS, plus what investors should watch in 2026.Twice a week, Stocks In Translation cuts through the market mayhem, noisy numbers and hyperbole to give you the information you need to make the right trade for your portfolio. You can find more episodes here, or watch on your favorite streaming service. This post was written by Lauren Pokedoff

headline: Salesforce Announces the General Availability of Slackbot – Your Personal Agent for Work
summary: SAN FRANCISCO, January 13, 2026--AI has changed our personal lives, answering any question, unleashing our creativity, and delivering tailored insights with a simple prompt. But in the workplace, AI hasn’t yet been so transformative — bogged down by unintuitive interfaces, fragmented across multiple teams and tools, beset by hallucinations and inconsistency, and lacking the context that the workplace demands.

content.title: Salesforce Announces the General Availability of Slackbot – Your Personal Agent for Work
content.summary: SAN FRANCISCO, January 13, 2026--AI has changed our personal lives, answering any question, unleashing our creativity, and delivering tailored insights with a simple prompt. But in the workplace, AI hasn’t yet been so transformative — bogged down by unintuitive interfaces, fragmented across multiple teams and tools, beset by hallucinations and inconsistency, and lacking the context that the workplace demands.

headline: Confluence Technologies Appoints Kevin Rozanski Chief Financial Officer
summary: PITTSBURGH, January 13, 2026--Confluence Technologies, Inc. ("Confluence"), a global leader in regulatory, analytics, and investor communications solutions for the investment management industry, today announced the appointment of Kevin Rozanski as Chief Financial Officer. Rozanski will be responsible for shaping and executing the company’s financial strategy, overseeing financial operations, and partnering with the leadership team to drive sustainable growth and long-term value creation.

content.title: Confluence Technologies Appoints Kevin Rozanski Chief Financial Officer
content.summary: PITTSBURGH, January 13, 2026--Confluence Technologies, Inc. ("Confluence"), a global leader in regulatory, analytics, and investor communications solutions for the investment management industry, today announced the appointment of Kevin Rozanski as Chief Financial Officer. Rozanski will be responsible for shaping and executing the company’s financial strategy, overseeing financial operations, and partnering with the leadership team to drive sustainable growth and long-term value creation.

headline: Onebrief Closes $200M Series D at $2.15B Valuation, Acquires Battle Road Digital
summary: HONOLULU, January 13, 2026--Onebrief closed a $200M Series D at a post-money valuation of over $2B, and acquired Battle Road Digital to expand next-gen wargaming capabilities.

content.title: Onebrief Closes $200M Series D at $2.15B Valuation, Acquires Battle Road Digital
content.summary: HONOLULU, January 13, 2026--Onebrief closed a $200M Series D at a post-money valuation of over $2B, and acquired Battle Road Digital to expand next-gen wargaming capabilities.

headline: 1 Profitable Stock with Impressive Fundamentals and 2 Facing Challenges
summary: Even if a company is profitable, it doesn’t always mean it’s a great investment. Some struggle to maintain growth, face looming threats, or fail to reinvest wisely, limiting their future potential.

content.title: 1 Profitable Stock with Impressive Fundamentals and 2 Facing Challenges
content.summary: Even if a company is profitable, it doesn’t always mean it’s a great investment. Some struggle to maintain growth, face looming threats, or fail to reinvest wisely, limiting their future potential.

headline: PossibleNOW Launches DNCSolution™ for Salesforce
summary: PossibleNOW, the leader in customer contact compliance solutions, today announced the launch of DNCSolution for Salesforce. Through our partnership, DNCSolution now provides a first-of-its-kind Do Not Contact (DNC) and TCPA compliance enforcement across the entire Salesforce Agentforce 360 platform.

content.title: PossibleNOW Launches DNCSolution™ for Salesforce
content.summary: PossibleNOW, the leader in customer contact compliance solutions, today announced the launch of DNCSolution for Salesforce. Through our partnership, DNCSolution now provides a first-of-its-kind Do Not Contact (DNC) and TCPA compliance enforcement across the entire Salesforce Agentforce 360 platform.

headline: Can Salesforce's Data 360 Push Drive Its Next Phase of Sales Growth?
summary: CRM leans on Data 360 to counter slowing growth, integrating AI tools to boost higher-value contracts as revenue growth cools to single digits.

content.title: Can Salesforce's Data 360 Push Drive Its Next Phase of Sales Growth?
content.summary: CRM leans on Data 360 to counter slowing growth, integrating AI tools to boost higher-value contracts as revenue growth cools to single digits.

headline: The Dow Is Lagging the S&P 500, Nasdaq. Big Stocks Like JPMorgan, Microsoft, and Goldman Sachs Are to Blame.
summary: The Dow’s big drop on Tuesday was worsened by some of its most important stocks. The blue-chip index fell 375 points, or 0.8%, in Tuesday trading. The S&P 500 was down 0.4%. The Nasdaq Composite was off 0.

content.title: The Dow Is Lagging the S&P 500, Nasdaq. Big Stocks Like JPMorgan, Microsoft, and Goldman Sachs Are to Blame.
content.summary: The Dow’s big drop on Tuesday was worsened by some of its most important stocks. The blue-chip index fell 375 points, or 0.8%, in Tuesday trading. The S&P 500 was down 0.4%. The Nasdaq Composite was off 0.

headline: Nasdaq Is Getting a Boost From Some Big Tech Names
summary: The Nasdaq Composite turned back around in early Tuesday afternoon trading.  The Dow, which was weighed down by struggles among its larger stocks like Salesforce, Visa, and JPMorgan Chase, was down 275 points, or 0.6%.  A rally in Alphabet, up 2.4%, and Nvidia, up 1.4%, helped lift the Nasdaq.

content.title: Nasdaq Is Getting a Boost From Some Big Tech Names
content.summary: The Nasdaq Composite turned back around in early Tuesday afternoon trading.  The Dow, which was weighed down by struggles among its larger stocks like Salesforce, Visa, and JPMorgan Chase, was down 275 points, or 0.6%.  A rally in Alphabet, up 2.4%, and Nvidia, up 1.4%, helped lift the Nasdaq.

headline: Nasdaq Turns Lower Amid Mag 7 Struggles
summary: So much for the Nasdaq Composite’s turnaround. The tech-heavy index was back down 0.2% on Tuesday after briefly turning positive. The S&P 500 was down 0.3%. The Dow sank 337 points, or 0.7%. Salesforce, down 6.

content.title: Nasdaq Turns Lower Amid Mag 7 Struggles
content.summary: So much for the Nasdaq Composite’s turnaround. The tech-heavy index was back down 0.2% on Tuesday after briefly turning positive. The S&P 500 was down 0.3%. The Dow sank 337 points, or 0.7%. Salesforce, down 6.

headline: Google Momentum Continues Amid Apple Deal As Software Stocks Hammered
summary: Alphabet hit a record high as Wall Street firms raised their price targets on Google stock in the wake of a new AI deal with Apple.

content.title: Google Momentum Continues Amid Apple Deal As Software Stocks Hammered

headline: Dow Drops Nearly 400 Points After JPMorgan's Earnings Flop
summary: Stocks pulled back from closing highs on Tuesday after the start to earnings season kickoff flopped. The Dow Jones Industrial Average fell 398 points, or 0.8%. The S&P 500 was down 0.2%. The Nasdaq Composite was down 0.

content.title: Dow Drops Nearly 400 Points After JPMorgan's Earnings Flop

headline: Stocks Fall Ahead of Closing Bell
summary: Stocks were in the red in the final hour of trading. The Dow Jones Industrial Average—dragged down by sharp declines in some of its larger stocks like Salesforce, Visa, and JPMorgan—was down 496 points, or 1%, after earlier being down 522 points.

content.title: Stocks Fall Ahead of Closing Bell
content.summary: Stocks were in the red in the final hour of trading. The Dow Jones Industrial Average—dragged down by sharp declines in some of its larger stocks like Salesforce, Visa, and JPMorgan—was down 496 points, or 1%, after earlier being down 522 points.

headline: Why Salesforce (CRM) Shares Are Plunging Today
summary: Shares of CRM software giant Salesforce (NYSE:CRM) fell 6.3% in the afternoon session after a wave of competitive anxiety hit the enterprise software sector sparked by a high-profile downgrade of Adobe, triggering a broader sell-off in high-valuation cloud stocks.

content.title: Why Salesforce (CRM) Shares Are Plunging Today
content.summary: Shares of CRM software giant Salesforce (NYSE:CRM) fell 6.3% in the afternoon session after a wave of competitive anxiety hit the enterprise software sector sparked by a high-profile downgrade of Adobe, triggering a broader sell-off in high-valuation cloud stocks.

headline: Stock Market Today, Jan. 13: AMD Rallies as Banking Stocks Struggle
summary: On Jan. 13, 2026, positive inflation data wasn't enough to bouy banking stocks today after mixed results from JPMorgan.
